meanings.definition: A man's male servant who takes care of his clothes and performs other personal services.
meanings.sent1: The wealthy gentleman's valets always ensured his clothes were neatly pressed and ready to wear.
meanings.sent2: The valets at the mansion were busy attending to the needs of their employer.
meanings.sent3: The valets accidentally mixed up the outfits, leading to a comical fashion show mix-up.
meanings.sent4: The valets of the rich man's wardrobe guarded his suits like precious treasures.
meanings.sent5: The valets' meticulous attention to detail made them indispensable to their employer.

meanings.definition: A person who parks cars for guests at a hotel or restaurant.
meanings.sent1: The valets swiftly parked the cars of the arriving guests in an orderly manner.
meanings.sent2: The hotel valets were always ready to assist visitors with parking their vehicles.
meanings.sent3: The valets played a game of musical cars as they skillfully maneuvered vehicles in the parking lot.
meanings.sent4: The valets' precision in parking cars was like a choreographed dance on the hotel's driveway.
meanings.sent5: The valets' efficiency in managing the parking area impressed all the hotel guests.
